Reviews.Title: “Of the worst hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Akram A
Reviews.Content: I reached the hotel and I have a formal reservation of the hotel At the reception told me there was no reservation and I have a room large barrier Is this possible, but hotel star hotels and one or less possible this happens

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Magedashraf
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel apartments nicely located at a walking distance from the astonishing burj-khalifa (tallest building in the world), The dancing fountains, Dubai mall, the palace and souq albihar. The apartment is spacious nicely decorated. Go for the fountains view and not for city view (hope I knew this before going) you 'll get to see the dancing fountains from the comfort of your room which is pretty cool. Cons: Noisy because of numerous construction sites near by. Don't know if it's the case for city view rooms only or all rooms. It's not an hotel it's hotel apartments so no bar, night clubs..

Reviews.Title: “Very bad appartment.”
Reviews.Author: Prada_12
Reviews.Content: That is appartment not hotel in my mind.very small lobby and poor service.same offer can select another best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Another awful hotel from the Wyndham Group”
Reviews.Author: Rachelepoh
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the hotel's "Business Centre" as the the internet has been out of service since I arrived this afternoon. 1. I found the hotel's website when I was looking for accommodation in Dubai. This is my first time in Dubai. I tried to book my dates but was told that there was no room available. I called the reservations number and was put on hold and the operator finally came back and told me that the reservations department was very busy and that if I left my name and number, they would call me back. They never did, and I should have taken this as a sign and not booked my stay. 2. I finally managed to get a booking for the night after I had initially planned on staying, for a 3 night stay. I arrived at the hotel at 12:30PM (after a 7.5 hour flight) and waited in line to check in. When I finally got to the front of the line, the person at the front office, couldn't find my reservation. I waited while I she checked the confirmation email I showed her and she told me to have a sit and wait (again). After a while, someone from reservations came to inform me that they were working on it and that they would get back to me soon. I asked for a wifi login code/password and was given one - but it didn't work. 3. Finally, this reservations person came back and told me it was all sorted and that I could proceed to check in. I made my way to the reception and it was full with 3 lines of at least 5 people in each line. Not wanting to wait as I had things to do, I gave word to the conceirge that I would leave my bags and come back for check in. 4, A few hours later, I came back to the hotel to find that the reception was even more crowded with lines of people and all the seats taken. I tried to get the attention of the different people behind the front desk but to no avail. I had to walk out to the concierge and ask them if they culd help me, but they told me to speak to the front office manager. I went to the front desk and interupted the lady I spoke to earlier and she pointed to a lady next to her. 5. The lady then told me to wait (again) and I went out to speak to the concierge again. This time someone came to help me, but he disappeared again after telling me to wait. After several minutes, he finally came out to tell me that it was all sorted, at the same time the front office manager also came over to talk to me. Then they both left me and I stood there wondering if I was ever going to get into my room. 6. I go up to the counter to ask the manager what was going on and she tells me to wait for what must be the 7th time I was told to wait. Then the person she was dealing with started complaining that he had been waiting for 2 hours. 7. I am finally brought to my room and I quickly get online to check my emails and try to get a bit of work done, and the internet doesn't work. The front office manager finally comes up to check me in and I ask her about the internet. She told me that she would go down to speak with her IT manager and fix the problem. I told her that the earlier code didn't work either and she said she would send up a new code for me. I go to have a shower and having received the new code, I try to get online - Surprise, Suprise, it doesn't work. 8. I call down and ask to speak to her and the operator tells me she's very busy with a guest. Then I ask him if I could speak to someone who can help me with the internet and he said that he would have the manager call me back. Half and hour later, I call again and the operator said that he will call me back in 15 min as they're trying to reach the IT manager. An hour later, I called again and this time the operator told me that the IT manager is out of the hotel, it's a Friday and that he can't say if the internet will get fixed, and told me to go down to the busines centre if I needed the internet. So, here I am, writing this review, online, and ironically in a hotel that has no internet because it's a Friday and the IT manager has left the hotel. You know a hotel is terrible when you start thinking about cutting your trip short cos it started out so badly. I got a one bedroom suite and it's pretty ordinary. ALL the windows face construction sites, around 3 or 4 sites, so I've had to keep the curtains drawn the whole time for privacy. . Like the Night Hotel in NY that I reviewed before, the condition of the room is not great - The dressing "table" is screwed into the wall and falling off, and has a black burn mark on it, dirty covers on the couch, bed is soft, none of the usual bathroom amenities, blinds that don't work, hangers in the wardrobe have hairs stuck on them (sic), wardrobe doors that don't close properly, etc. This is the 2nd time that I'm staying at a Wyndham property and I hope it's the last. What is the saying? Fool me once......

Reviews.Title: “Close to Burj Khalifa”
Reviews.Author: merajulhaq
Reviews.Content: This is very close to Burj Khalifa and just walking distance to Dubai Mall dont forget to take free shuttle service to Jumeirah Beach Park, Dubai Mall, and the Metro. hotel is very spacious, open-plan studios and suites with a separate living room. The hotel has a temperature-controlled swimming pool and a badminton and racquetball court, also a snice gym to workout.there is a Orchid Restaurant they serve all-day dining and also provide room service. Since i had goone for convention it was very easy for me and just 5-minute drive from the Dubai International Financial Centre, Convention Centre, After work Jumeirah Beach is 10 minutes' drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Almois
Reviews.Content: I spend 10 days with my family, really is the perfect place, quiet and clean

Reviews.Title: “Shame to be one of Ramada hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Omar_sa
Reviews.Content: Simply, the level of service, rooms, staff was not up to a 5-star hotel. Location is the only thing that attracts people to come.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for short trip”
Reviews.Author: dirkGhent_Belgium
Reviews.Content: ideal location (10 minutes walk to the creeks and souks, 5 min to metro station), big rooms and good breakfast. Very friendly staff... no complaints at all !

Reviews.Title: “Not really a hotel. An apartmentbuilding. Predominantly arabian guests”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinne
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week in this "hotel", the first week og November, and want to point out a few things that might be of interest. This is not a hotel, but an apartment building. The website is not giving an accurate description of the place. There is a reception and a restaurant (Orchid) which is not nice and quite small, and a swimmingpool. The breakfast is arabic, and we found the overall standard to be very poor. We had pre-payed breakfast (90 Dirham pr person pr day), but ate there only the first two days. The coffee was thin, the pastry really bad, the cheese sweaty, and the list goes on. You will be much better of going to the supermarket next door and buy what you want to eat there. Then make it in your apartment. We stayed in apt. nr 1005. The toilet clogged up, and we tried several times to get them to fix it. evetually we grabbed hold of the maid who came to clean the apt. daily, and then she called maintenance. The equipment in the kitchen lacks many things. There are two cups for coffe, two knifes, two wineglasses etc. There is a washing machine, a toaster and a micro-wave, refrigerator and water boiler. No kitchen towels. There is room service, but no menu in the rooms. We asked for it, but they didn't have it. We were told to just call room service and ask. The staff in the restaurant speak porly english, with an indian accent. The pool is heated (30 degrees? Too warm when there are 30 degrees in the shadow). There is no pool-bar. No smoking by the pool area. The pool lies in shadow until noon. At the moment there is heavy constructionwork going on, and this will continue for at least a couple of years. The staff is friendly, but this is by no means a 4-5 star place! Three elevators and 31 floors makes for waiting-time. There are mainly arabians here (at least while we were there), I would say 90% were wearing the traditional arabian clothes. We felt very out of place. The sea is quite far away, so you can hardly see it. There is a vague sight of it over the other buildings. You can see a strip of it if you consentrate. They do not answer the phone in the reception. They are nice and forthcoming, but they do not really act on our request. Even though the rooms look nice on the web-site, they do not feel luxurious. The colours aren't nice in reality. It is close to the mall, but not with direct access to it. I would give this place max. three stars, and would not return. One is probably better off renting a cheaper apartment and get what one is paying for, not expecting a whole lot. There is an excellent pizzeria near by, "PIZZERO". They also deliver. Their pizzas are probably among the best italian pizzas I've ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly Staff :)”
Reviews.Author: Kholel
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to stay if you're looking to be in the middle of it all in Dubai. Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa are 10-15 minutes away by foot. I got a suite that featured a city view. But i still got to see the fountain and the Burj from the veranda. Other rooms feature a great view of those. It's clean and modern and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, going back!”
Reviews.Author: Skyler84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment and it was LOVELY! The rooms are very spacious, the hotel is well kept and overall it is very well done. It has a great location, we could walk to Dubai Mall and has such a great view of the Dubai fountains. The rooms come equipped with everything imaginable that you may need, from fully equipped kitchen to well appointed toiletteries. For the price, it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitika M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night, in the one bedroom apartment with King bed, and it turned out to be a relatively pleasant stay. Our balcony was facing the construction site, which was not very pleasant, but I didn't stay there too long for it to bother me. Ramada downtown is situated very close to the Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa. You can literally walk to the mall if you don't mind the heat. The staff at check in wasn't the most courteous, one of them couldn't process our reservation, and the other was being very flirtatious, which according to me, is not professional. However, have a good apartment with a sizable room and a really nice living room. The breakfast was quite good. I would recommend this hotel to anybody that wants to stay close to Dubai mall or Burj Khalifa, but not pay the exorbitant rates at the Address or Armani Hotel. Btw, at Dhs1300 a night, it's still not very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Goods and Bads”
Reviews.Author: IKEINU
Reviews.Content: I can assure you that location and equipment is perfect, it is quite near Dubai mall, easy to go around and has kitchen and laundry facility inside each room. However, administration is horrible especially for long time stayers, management never keeps a promise. Whatever we request or discuss, everything is ignored and end up in abrupt resignation of a person in charge. This happened more than twice during my stay. Surely there is no takeover, so every time, our negotiation starts from the beginning, ignored and discarded again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special except the view”
Reviews.Author: mymzakari
Reviews.Content: I just came from Dubai last week, i was having great expectations about the hotel. I stayed in joniour suit,which was served with kitchen, microwave,laundry and fridge. I liked all these utilities, in addition to the view,it was fantastic over the fountain and khaleefa tower. What i disliked , it is the light comming from outside behinde the curtains,you feel yourself in outdoor. Also there is no good light control on the room eg. you can not keep the table light turned on only,you have to turn it on all. The reception always respond late to my calls. In my opinoin,there are many hotels around which might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate = Very nice hotel in burj dubai”
Reviews.Author: sophNL
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. old hotel i guess but very well maintain. the helpdesk is very helpfull & professional the breakfast is just excellent, fresh fruit, fresh orange juice, fresh eggs = fresh everything! the breakfast room is very comfortable also (Bistrot café). Rooms are large & spacious. The metro is just 10 min. walk, perfect if you need to go anywhere in dubai taxi's are easy to catch as the hotel is in a main intersection PERFECT, will stay again and again

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: wklau
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on and off for 6 months whilst travelling back and forth and it was a great base. This hotel had everything you wanted : gym, outdoor area, free internet, fantastic views. The service was great, the staff were exceptional. I would recommend this hotel over and over again

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Kiran_Nair
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown at Burj Dubai , its a good hotel , great location and excellent staff at front desk and restaurants . The room is large , though almost 30 % is wasted . As one enters the room , you are on a "landing" which is tiled and gives one an impression that this is an extension of the bath which has identical tiles. Had this area been carpeted or covered with wooden tiles, the room would have looked different and really outstanding . The choice of food at Bistro a la carte is interesting but short on snacks . The Indian food is good . The breakfast is lavish but not very different from that served at other hotels. The internet service is extra at Dirham 31 per hour ( appx $ 10 ) . My experience was not pleasant with the use of Internet. I paid for an hour and in first go used it for thirty minutes. To my disappointment , the balance time was not "credited" to me and had I wanted to use it again , I would have had to pay an additional amount to start surfing. The management should include the internet cost in the room rent or charge a very nominal amount on per day basis .This was a major negative aspect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: amirali10
Reviews.Content: We loved nearly everything about this hotel - its front desk staff, complimentary shuttle staff, bell staff everyone made the hotel stay really enjoyable and convenient for my family. The room we had was the 1 BR with the Business Bay view. Otherwise good view, however there was some noise of the construction site opposite the street - but nothing too much bother. Fountain is a 10 minute walk and Dubai Mall a very pleasant 15 minute walk from the hotel. Rest of the areas very easily accessible by Taxi. Metro station walk is a bit far (15 - 20 minutes) so you either take a cab or their shuttle service. Just a couple of small things - shuttle service should be more frequent. However taxis were easy to catch and in abundane. While breakfast was the same every day of our 8 day stay - could have had more variety. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No stars for this hotel from me.”
Reviews.Author: RocketClub1
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Ramada in Bur Dubai these past two and half years but I will now being choosing another hotel. My first experiences with this particular Ramada were good ones. Back then it was a no hassle deal for the hotel staff to provide a complementary ride to and from the airport, free use of the business office with free internet for this business traveler to use at my leisure and the counter staff was friendly and were eager to accommodate me with extra water for the room. When I arrived without a reservation the front desk did their best to find me the better room price for my stay. I came and went and could have guests without question. However, my last three stays at this Ramada have gone from awkward to very uncomfortable and now to downright unwelcoming. On one occasion I was unexpectedly charged after I had reserved complementary hotel transportation to the airport as I surprisingly found out upon arriving at the airport destination. During my next stay I brought this transportation matter to the attention of the hotel manager who was eager to make my transportation requirement to and from the airport a cost free reality after I threatened to cancel my upcoming reservations. Most recently, the counter staff told me that because I made my reservation via the internet that I would no longer be afforded hotel transportation to and from the airport and that I would need to take a taxi. Remember, I have been a regular customer at this particular hotel for awhile now. During my past three or four stays, I have had to repeatedly ask for replenished drinking water when during my early stays water and fresh fruit was always to be found in my room without having to ask. A couple of stays ago, I was informed by the desk staff that I would be charged to utilize the business office internet which would be priced at fifteen minute intervals. The final straw came when I had invited guests come to see me off while I finished packing an hour before my checkout. I was stopped by security who would not allow my guests into the hotel. Embarrassed, I confronted the desk staff and threaten to not stay there anymore. They then put their rude security guy back on his chain. I didn’t even know that they had a security guy, so I am guessing that he would be a new hotel hire which will only increase the cost of staying there. This hotel’s rates have gone up quite a bit over the past couple of years but the quality of customer care and service has also gone down quite a bit, I know I have been paying more for less. Now I will be staying in another hotel in Bur Dubai, one that offers good customer service and wants my business. The Bur Dubai Ramada has truly taken on an inhospitable behavior.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: tbdreams
Reviews.Content: The service was really bad. Although i called the hotel to confirm my booking and they took note of my arrival at 3:00PM. I arrived at 3:15PM to be told my room is not ready yet. Apparently the occupants did not leave yet. The receptionist was apologetic and tried to convince me that since the hotel was heavily booked it was normal to be late for 1 to 2 hours.. The lobby was so small and crowded i could not imagine staying that long to wait for my room. In general the furniture, floors, doors, amenities etc. all are tired of bad quality that could meet a 2 star to 3 star standard at best. It was advertised as burj dubai / fountain view however the view was limited somewhat. e.g. in the balcony i could see the burj from one angle only and have to look to the left of the balcony normal sitting orientation to see the fountain. The glass of the windows was not clean all over the flat. That included the glass on the balcony which obstructed visibility when sitting. The bathrooms were not clean. The towels were not very clean and of bad quality. Most importantly the water pressure in the bathroom and shower was very weak and added to the feeling that it was 2 to 3 stars service. The AC fans were noisy. Not sure about AC cooling because it was December. liked best: walking distance to Dubai mall - it is nice walk with the nice weather in December. liked least: room not ready at 3:00 PM for 2 hours and service and quality do not meet high price charged for it. overall i regretted staying in this hotel which charged me premium for a less than average service. The price is very exaggerated even with the burj / fountain view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Option with great service.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 8 days recently. If you are looking for a non beach, downtown option then look no further than here. It’s very central and a handy walk from a number of going out options as well as a short taxi ride to many more. The apartments are clean, spacious and well equipped. You have all the luxury of a hotel suite at a decent rate. The staff were excellent and I could not speak highly enough of them. From the guys at the concierge desk through to the management all really decent, friendly and helpful people. The hotel does not have a bar so pick up something at the Duty Free when you arrive but that should not put you off in the slightest as there are loads of social options nearby if you run dry. I was in Dubai with work, my wife was with me and it suited us both for different reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with briliant service”
Reviews.Author: steffendenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada for one night between the 12th and 13th October and I can only recommend the hotel. Really nice apartment and the reception staffs delivered an excellent service and were really helpful throughout my stay. The hotel is located in a convenient location within walking distance to the Dubai Mall / Dubai Fountain and only 20 min taxi ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - you can't get closer to the Burj Khalifa / Dubai Mall (at this price)”
Reviews.Author: zurich_man
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 nights. This hotel is in fact a kind of 'serviced apartment'-style hotel. You get much more than just a room, cause the apartments include a fully equipped kitchen, living room, spacious bath room and a nice bedroom with lots of wardrobe / storage room (I am thinking here of long-term rentals). The location is within walking distance of the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall. To use the metro (and because there is lots of construction work going on around this hotel area) one has to use a taxi, or the hotel shuttle bus service (provided free of charge). Next door to the Ramada building is a supermarket (open from 09:00 - 22:00) where on can buy things for breakfast / diner. Ideal for families who dont want to eat out all the time. So, the location is a big PLUS and the price / rate I booked at was VERY good for the service / apartment which I got. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, would recomend to others!”
Reviews.Author: nicoll_lj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great, you can see the dubai mall from your room. We stayed in a room which had lovely views over the dubai fountains, they were great. The staff are very helpfull, there is usally taxis outside the hotel. It is about 20mins from the airport. The rooms are spacious and very clean. There is complimentary water/juice etc left in your fridge. The facilities are good. Internet free and fast. There is a small supermarket about 5mins from the hotel. You could walk to the dubai mall it takes about 10/15mins. It is a nice walk. There is a nice pool but since it was July it was too humid outside to use it. The only negative aspect is that the hotel does not serve alcohol in the mini bar. Seemingly it is down to the managers choice. If we had known we would have brought some from duty free. We stayed with a 4 year old and a 2 year old. I had researched to find an apartahotel and I was very pleased with my choice regarding location/price/cleanliness etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great when it comes to nitty gritties”
Reviews.Author: Freezesubzero
Reviews.Content: I'm staying for 1 year and had to move apartment once already due to too much noice from nabours. (Mainly arab families with kids staying up well past midnight))(Children screaming, listening to people going to toilets, people's foot steps sound like elephants on the run). All else is OK, but bad insulation makes this a bad hotel if you prefer a quiet stay. Here you never feel alone, you can hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: othmane
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in this hotel from 04 - 07 may attending a travel trade fair and really enjoyed my stay at this brand new property. Check in was a bit slow as they could not find our booking and the front office manager came to do the check in but it was all fine. Room was spacious and clean, the vew is breathtaking, in the evening, you can watch the fountain show from your bed as well as the massive Burj Dubai. Hotel offered complimentary shuttle to the trade centre, dubai mall as well as to jumeira beach park which needs to be booked in advance. Overall, very nice hotel, I would just recomment a better training for the front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel & Great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkDWUK
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel about 6 months old. facilities are excellent and the location a bonus. The rooms are very spacious, clean and overlook the Lake to the Burj Kalyifa with the fountain show. As this is on the opposite side of the lake there is about a 8 min walk to get round the lake to the Dubai mall area. Staff were all very courtious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tidy and clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tin_Sandhu
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I had been to Dubai... The first time we stayed in the Jumeirah region and this time we decided to stay downtown so that we could walk to some places... This Ramada hotel is about 10 min walk from Dubai Mall... The view from the room was the Burj Kalifah (Worlds tallest building currently) and overlooking the famous water fountain display that occurs approx every 20mins from late afternoon to aprrox 22:30. The room was clean and the staff were as accomodating as possible. The only downside was some communication issues with the in house restaurant with misunderstandings of the order and timings which in fiarness they did try their best to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: baecc
Reviews.Content: Likes: * Fantastic location, within walking distance(about 15 mins stroll) to Burj Khalifa, Souk Al Bahar, Musical Fountain/Lake, Dubai Mall area. Clean & wide pathway with a nice view. * Our 2 bedroom apartment is very spacious and from the living room you can enjoy the musical fountain shows as well as the Burj & surrounding areas * Very comfortable King & Queen size beds; kitchen with utensils, crockery as well as pots & pans; induction cooker; big fridge; microwave oven, oven, kettle provided *Daily shuttle bus to Dubai Mall and Jumeirah Beach Park *swimming pool & baby pool; kids playground with nice view *free dates at the lobby Dislikes: *lack of attention to details eg. no mats or slippers for the balcony area; no washing suds; no cleaning towels in the kitchen; no wine glasses *poor quality of shampoo, conditioners & soap (comparing with Suitehotel Mall of Emirates) *hard cushion & sofas in living room (considering the price we are paying) *No response from hotel booking website; instead we booked through Ramada International website(best rates); when we phoned the hotel, they asked us to book from Bookings.com?! Overall we would still stay here again because of it's location and spacious apartment and it's really convenient especially for families.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Downtown Burj Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Boulevard Road | PO Box: 116566, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
